info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN WESTMORELAND AND NORTHEASTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Stanton, or 10 miles southwest of Greensburg, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Latrobe, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Youngwood, Lawson Heights, New Stanton, Ligonier, Calumet-Norvelt, Everson, Madison, Arona, Youngstown, Hunker, Laurel Mountain, Donegal, Champion, Herminie, Acme, Jones Mills, and Laurel Mountain State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 51 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 71 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania.
